CatDescriptText: Cutline of published image in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1969, page 9 reads: "MARCHING PROUD AND BEAUTIFUL - Led by Black Coalition leaders the Black Monday demonstration winds its way through downtown Pittsburgh. Close observers figured that as many as 10,000 people took part in demonstration . It was described as the largest demonstration of its kind in the history of the city."
TitMainTitle: Black Construction Coalition Black Monday demonstration with protesters marching down Liberty Avenue past Federal Building and Continental Trailways bus station, Downtown
